Questions.Text: Your manager has asked you to write a sales report for the next team meeting.

Answers.Text: Use verbs like will not and it will instead of contractions like won't and it'll
Use all caps and emoji to emphasize enthusiasm

Questions.Text: You are telling your friend about the new car that another friend just bought.

Answers.Text: Avoid using the first-person I
Use slang terms such as sweet ride instead of excellent car

Questions.Text: You have been asked by the charge nurse to write safe-handling instructions that will be posted above the container for used needles and other sharps.

Answers.Text: Use 12 point font, as proscribed by APA sstyle, and paragraphs that are at least 6 sentences long, as you were taught in school.
Use a large, bold font that everyone will be able to see and a numbered list that breaks down the process into individual steps.

Questions.Text: Working for a mechanical engineering company, you're asked by the project manager to prepare a progress report.

Answers.Text: Include a title page, a table of contents, page numbers, and a references page.
Use multiple exclamation marks at the end of important or interesting sentences, like this!!!!!

Questions.Text: You are writing an email to your team lead, accepting her invitation to lunch to celebrate your success on a recent project.

Answers.Text: Use multiple paragraphs to suggest possible restaurants, outline your dietary restrictions, and complain that your previous team lead never recognized your good work.
Send a short note that indicates you would be very happy to meet her for lunch.

Questions.Text: You have been asked by your manager at an early-learning centre to design a new play-based program for children in the toddlers' group.

Answers.Text: Support your recommendations with detailed descriptions, references to relevant child development research, and examples of best practices used by other centres.
Present your recommendations in a bullet-point list.

Questions.Text: Before heading into a sales presentation, you send a quick text message to your colleague at the office that you will not be available for the next hour.

Answers.Text: Ask someone else on your sales team to review the text message for spelling and grammar.
Hit send as soon as you finish typing the text message.

Questions.Text: As a public relations specialist for a restaurant chain, you need to write a media release in response to a negative customer experience that has become viral on social media.

Answers.Text: Plan the key points of the press release before writing a first draft, and then ask members of your company's legal department to review its content before distributing a revised draft to the media.
Send the release to media outlets immediately in an attempt to control the story.

Questions.Text: You are starting a home renovation business and your website needs text that will convince prospective clients to hire you.

Answers.Text: Post testimonials from former clients, as well as factual information about the projects you have handled, such as their size or cost.
Use your memory of personal experiences to explain why you think you are worth hiring.

Questions.Text: You write a hospitality and tourism blog and you are writing a post about a new resort that you have recently visited.

Answers.Text: Refer to key terms and theories from a tourism management textbook to support your recommendation of the resort.
Share portions of the interviews you conducted with the resort's employees and other guests of the resort to support your recommendation.

Questions.Text: As a project manager at an event management company, you email one of your clients to recommend that they host a Canada Day BBQ to promote their new product.

Answers.Text: Include a footnote in your email to the Wikipedia page for Canada, citing your reference to July 1<sup>st</sup> as Canada Day.
Do not include any citations in this initial email, but be prepared to cite sales data justifying the expense of the event if your client asks for you to follow-up with a formal presentation.
